summary:
Amun was an important god in ancient Egypt, often linked to the Hermopolitan Ogdoad. He was first mentioned in the Old Kingdom and became the main god of Thebes, replacing Montu. Over time, Amun merged with the sun god Ra, forming Amun-Ra, a powerful deity.

Amun-Ra was seen as the creator of everything and the king of the gods. He was popular during the New Kingdom, helping the poor and being a central figure in people's faith. Greek writers even mentioned his worship outside Egypt, where he was known as Zeus Ammon or Jupiter Ammon.
title: Amun
